snippet: “No point being all British and coy about it,” said the pensions minister, Steve Webb, who said an idea of life expectancy can aid financial planning.
abstract: Steve Webb, Great Britain's pension minister, says retirees may soon be informed by the government of their likely life expectancy; his comments come a month after the government announced far-reaching overhaul of private pension rules that will allow retirees to choose a lump-sum payment instead of buying a guaranteed income until death.
lead_paragraph: “No point being all British and coy about it,” said the pensions minister, Steve Webb, who said an idea of life expectancy can aid financial planning.

headline.main: How Near Is the End? Britain May Tell Retirees
